title: Example code blocks
body:
Just checking out how code blocks look in my main languages

ruby

require 'json'
class Foo < Bar
  attr_reader :name
  def initialize name
    @name = name
  end

  def screaming_hello!
    puts "Hello, #{name}!!"
  end
end

go

(god damn go highlighting is boring)

package main
 
import (
    "fmt"
)
 
func main() {
    success := "success"
    failure := "failure"
    message := success
    defer func() { fmt.Println(message) }()                                                      
 
    var input int
    fmt.Println("enter 1 or 0")
    fmt.Scanln(&input)
    if input == 1 {
        message = failure
    }
}

haskell

import Text.RegexPR
import Data.Char

parsePeptide :: String -> [String]
parsePeptide peptideSequence = [ match | ((match,_),_) <- regexSequence ]
                        where regexSequence = gmatchRegexPR "\\([0-9][a-z]\\)|[a-z]" lowerSequence
                              lowerSequence = map toLower peptideSequence

fragmentsByLength :: Int -> [String] -> [[String]]
fragmentsByLength _ []   = []
fragmentsByLength len (x:xs)
  | len == 1             = [ a:[] | a <- (x:xs) ]
  | length (x:xs) >= len = (take len (x:xs)):(fragmentsByLength len xs)
  | otherwise            = []

so, now that i have these examples written out, i have a post that i can play with to modify the syntax highlighting. woo.
